page.title: 01Land area around N. Erradale
page.content: This is a moorland area with hills running down to the sea. It has one single track road with passing places with one road off to North Erradale. There is a garage and workshop. Many of the houses have extensions and run a Bed and Breakfast service. The Highlands and Islands Development Board gave grants for the extensions. Other houses appear to be used solely as holiday houses. Although most of the old crofts have been abandoned and became ruins there are still a few flocks of sheep kept on the rough grazing area. The soil is made up of areas of peat, bog and moorland. Most of the land is used for rough grazing.
